result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy J Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--no acts or threats of violence toward any person
--no physical discipline of any child
--no violent contact with T.A.R.
--to undergo an Anger Management Assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment
--Mr. Simmons shall not to provide any childcare for any child unless approved by the Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge O'Brien presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 2:05pm. 
Defendant Leroy J Simmons in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (the victim's mother is present); the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Simmons on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person
--no physical discipline of any child
--no violent contact with T.A.R.
--to undergo an Anger Management Assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment
--Mr. Simmons shall not to provide any childcare for any child unless approved by the Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  1 day
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given 
recess 2:24pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on March 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 2:32 pm 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Leroy J Simmons in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Simmons waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Atty Luchsinger orally motions to modify bond; did informally notice DAs Office
ADA Shock: No objection to hearing matter today; Arguments presented by Counsel
Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond
Recess: 2:44 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 2/26/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 3/14/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Conflict review worksheet
Probable cause statement
Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:45 pm
Defendant Leroy J Simmons in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charge and maximum penalties recited
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with TAR 
-No physical discipline of any child 

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit (requested by the defense).
Court reviews conflict review worksheet, Court finds that there is no conflict and signs the conflict review worksheet.

Recess: 1:54 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 1/31/14 at 8:30 am
